attributes.action: Replace Council Tax with a Poll Tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I propose the re-introduction of a Poll Tax to replace Council Tax.

Council Tax is inherently unfair. A level of tax, determined by the size of the property irrespective of the number of occupants, is totally illogical.

If the purpose of Council Tax is to fund local services then all users of the services should pay.

At present properties housing extended families with several adults and children pay the same as an elderly couple living on their own. Single occupants only receive an illogical 25% reduction, rather than 50%

A Poll tax is absolutely fair. To be paid by all persons over 18 years to the council in which they are reside.

Poll Tax paid monthly by all adults would provide a greater income stream for the Councils and would reduce the overall taxation on any one individual. No means testing, no exemptions, no adjustment based on ability to pay – everyone pays the same.

Cheap to collect, easy to administer, no involvement of the Valuation Office Agency with regard to private residences.
